S100FC:source.S100CI:title: IHO Geospatial Information Registry - Concept Register
IHO GI Register proposal, currently pending approval

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Administrative Division
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A generic term for an administrative region within a country at a level below that of the sovereign state.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Applicable Load Line Zone
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The load line zone in which the port is located. Defined by the International Convention on Load Lines.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Application Profile
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Name of an application profile that can be used with the online resource.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Approach Description
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Description of the approach to a location.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Associated Feature Name
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The name of an associated feature.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Intended for designating related features in other datasets or products, since such feature instances cannot be linked by feature associations.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Available Berthing Length
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The length of a berth or dock which is available for use.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Berthing Assistance
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of assistance for mooring or anchoring operations.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Berthing Information
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Information about assistance or arrangements for a service related to berthing operations.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Line Personnel
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Personnel specializing in the mooring and unmooring of vessels.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Mooring Boat
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A boat which assists the securement of a vessel to a berth or mooring with ropes or anchor.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Mule
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A locomotive for moving vessels.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Tugboat
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A powerful small boat designed to pull or push larger ships or powerless barges.
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:remarks: "Tug" is also defined in the GI registry with a more limited definition: "A vessel specially built to perform towing operations." This feature catalogue uses the term with the more appropriate definition.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Bollard Description
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A textual description of the type of bollard at a berth or mooring facility.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Bollard Pull
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The rated pull force for a bollard or other structure used to secure a vessel’s lines at a berth, a mooring facility or to a tug.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Bollard Number
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: An identifier used to locate a specific bollard.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: A bollard is a small shaped post, mounted on a wharf or dolphin used to secure ship's lines.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Call Name
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The designated call name of a station; for example, radio station, radar station, pilot.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: This is the name used when calling a radio station by radio; for example, "Singapore Pilots".

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Call Sign
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The designated call-sign of a station (radio station, radar station, pilot, ...).

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Cardinal Direction
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Principal and intermediate compass points.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: North
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: 348.75-011.25 degrees (true north).

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Cargo Service
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of services related to the goods or items carried by vessels.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Defines an enumeration or codelist listing specific services.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Stevedoring
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The loading, unloading, moving or handling of cargo, ship's stores, gear, or other materials, into, in, on, or out of any vessel.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Cargo Surveying
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Inspection, evaluation or monitoring of the quantity, stowage, loading and unloading, and condition of cargo, and the effects of cargoes on vessel stability and safety.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Cargo Lashing
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The securement of cargo to the ship's structure and/or other cargo.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Draught Survey
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Determination of the quantity of certain types of bulk cargo by assessment of its effect on displacement when loaded in a vessel.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of Authority
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The type of person, government agency or organisation granted powers of managing or controlling access to and/or activity in an area.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Border Control
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The administration to prevent or detect and prosecute violations of rules and regulations at international boundaries.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Police
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The department of government, or civil force, charged with maintaining public order.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Port
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Person or corporation, owners of, or entrusted with or invested with the power of managing a port. May be called a Harbour Board, Port Trust, Port Commission, Harbour Commission, Marine Department.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Immigration
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The authority controlling people entering a country.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Health
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The authority with responsibility for checking the validity of the health declaration of a vessel and for declaring free pratique.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Coast Guard
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Organization keeping watch on shipping and coastal waters according to governmental law; normally the authority with responsibility for search and rescue.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Agricultural
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The authority with responsibility for preventing infection of the agriculture of a country and for the protection of the agricultural interests of a country.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Military
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A military authority which provides control of access to or approval for transit through designated areas or airspace.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Private Company
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A private or publicly owned company or commercial enterprise which exercises control of facilities, for example a calibration area.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Maritime Police
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A governmental or military force with jurisdiction in territorial waters. Examples could include Gendarmerie Maritime, Carabinierie, and Guardia Civil.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Environmental
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An authority with responsibility for the protection of the environment.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Fishery
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An authority with responsibility for the control of fisheries.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Finance
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An authority with responsibility for the control and movement of money.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Maritime
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A national or regional authority charged with administration of maritime affairs.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Customs
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The agency or establishment for collecting duties, tolls.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of Berth Location
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of a berth according to the method of describing its location or extent.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Wharf Reference Metre Mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A wharf or quay with reference position(s) given by one or more metre marks.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Wharf Reference Position
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A wharf or quay with reference position(s) given by one or more point or points in geographic coordinates.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Pier (Jetty)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A long, narrow structure extending into the water to afford a berthing place for vessels, to serve as a promenade, etc.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Conventional Mooring
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Mooring using the vessel's anchors and buoys to secure the vessel at multiple points.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of Cargo
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of the different types of cargo that a ship may be carrying.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: If item 7 is used, the nature of dangerous or hazardous cargoes can be amplified with category of dangerous or hazardous cargo.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Container
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: One of a number of standard sized cargo carrying units, secured using standard corner attachments and bar.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Passenger
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A fee paying traveller.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Livestock
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Live animals carried in bulk.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Dangerous or Hazardous
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Dangerous or hazardous cargo as described by the IMO International Maritime Dangerous Goods code.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Heavy Lift
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Indivisible heavy items of weight generally over 100 tons, and width or height greater than 100 metres.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Dry Bulk Cargo
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Commodity cargo that is transported unpackaged in large quantities. These types of goods usually need to be kept dry during the whole transportation period.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Liquid Bulk Cargo
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Liquids or gases that are transported in bulk and carried unpackaged.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Reefer Container Cargo
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Cargo transported in refrigerated containers, generally perishable commodities which require temperature-controlled transportation, such as fruit, meat, fish, vegetables, dairy products and other foods.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Ro-Ro Cargo
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Wheeled cargo, such as cars, busses, trucks, agricultural vehicles and cranes, that are driven on and off the ship on their own wheels or using a platform vehicle, such as a self-propelled modular transporter.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Project Cargo
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Project cargo is a term used to broadly describe the national or international transportation of large, heavy, high value, or critical (to the project they are intended for) pieces of equipment. Also commonly referred to as heavy lift, this includes shipments made of various components which need disassembly for shipment and reassembly after delivery.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Break Bulk Cargo
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Goods that are stowed on board ship in individually counted units, and not in intermodal containers nor in bulk as with oil or grain.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of Communication Preference
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of frequencies, VHF channels, telephone numbers, or other means of communication based on preference.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Preferred Calling
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The first choice channel or frequency to be used when calling a radio station.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Alternate Calling
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A channel or frequency to be used for calling a radio station when the preferred channel or frequency is busy or is suffering from interference.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Preferred Working
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The first choice channel or frequency to be used when working with a radio station.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Alternate Working
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A channel or frequency to be used for working with a radio station when the preferred working channel or frequency is busy or is suffering from interference.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category Of Dangerous Or Hazardous Cargo
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of dangerous goods or hazardous materials based on the International Maritime Dangerous Goods Code (IMDG Code).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 1 Div. 1.1
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Explosives, Division 1: Substances and articles which have a mass explosion hazard.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 1 Div. 1.2
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Explosives, Division 2: Substances and articles which have a projection hazard but not a mass explosion hazard.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 1 Div. 1.3
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Explosives, Division 3: Substances and articles which have a fire hazard and either a minor blast hazard or a minor projection hazard or both, but not a mass explosion hazard.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 1 Div. 1.4
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Explosives, Division 4: Substances and articles which present no significant hazard.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 1 Div. 1.5
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Explosives, Division 5: Very insensitive substances which have a mass explosion hazard.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 1 Div. 1.6
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Explosives, Division 6: Extremely insensitive articles which do not have a mass explosion hazard.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 2 Div. 2.1
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Gases, flammable gases.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 2 Div. 2.2
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Gases, non-flammable, non-toxic gases.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 2 Div. 2.3
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Gases, toxic gases.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 3
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Flammable liquids.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 4 Div. 4.1
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Flammable solids, self-reactive substances and desensitized explosives.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 4 Div. 4.2
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Substances liable to spontaneous combustion.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 4 Div. 4.3
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Substances which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 5 Div. 5.1
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Oxidizing substances.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 5 Div. 5.2
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Organic peroxides.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 6 Div. 6.1
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Toxic substances.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 6 Div. 6.2
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Infectious substances.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 7
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Radioactive material.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 8
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Corrosive substances.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 9
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Miscellaneous dangerous substances and articles.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Harmful Substances in Packaged Form
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Harmful substances are those substances which are identified as marine pollutants in the International Maritime Dangerous Goods Code (IMDG Code). Packaged form is defined as the forms of containment specified for harmful substances in the IMDG Code.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of Depths Description
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of significant aspects of depths about which information is provided.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Shoal
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A shallow elevation composed of unconsolidated material that may constitute a hazard to surface navigation.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: General Depth
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: General information about the vertical distance from the water surface to the bottom.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Controlling Depth
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The least depth in the approach or channel to an area, such as a port or anchorage, governing the maximum draft of vessels that can enter.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of Harbour Facility
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of harbour use.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: RoRo Terminal
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A terminal for roll-on roll-off ferries.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Ferry Terminal
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A terminal for passenger and vehicle ferries.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Fishing Harbour
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A harbour with facilities for fishing boats.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Yacht Harbour/Marina
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A harbour facility for small boats, yachts, etc., where supplies, repairs, and various services are available.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Naval Base
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A centre of operations for naval vessels.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Tanker Terminal
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A terminal for the bulk handling of liquid cargoes.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Passenger Terminal
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A terminal for the loading and unloading of passengers.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Shipyard
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A place where ships are built or repaired.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Container Terminal
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A terminal with facilities to load/unload or store shipping containers.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Bulk Terminal
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A terminal for the handling of bulk materials such as iron ore, coal, etc.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Ship Lift
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A platform powered by synchronous electric motors (for example syncrolift) used to lift vessels (larger than boats) in and out of the water.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Straddle Carrier
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A wheeled vehicle designed to lift and carry containers or vessels within its own framework. It is used for moving, and sometimes stacking, shipping containers and vessels.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Service Harbour
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A harbour within which the floating equipment (dredges, tugs ...) of harbour services are stationed.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Pilotage Service
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The services of a person who directs the movements of a vessel through pilot waters, usually a person who has demonstrated extensive knowledge of channels, aids to navigation, dangers to navigation, etc., in a particular area and is licensed for that area, are available.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Service and Repair
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A place where mechanical services or repairs can be undertaken to engines or other vessel equipment.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Quarantine Station
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A medical control center located in an isolated spot ashore where patients with contagious diseases from vessel in quarantine are taken.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of Mooring/Warping Facility
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A place or structure to which a vessel can be secured.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Dolphin
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A post or group of posts, used for mooring or warping a vessel, or as an aid to navigation. The dolphin may be in the water, on a wharf or on the beach.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Deviation Dolphin
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A post or group of posts, which a vessel may swing around for compass adjustment.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Bollard
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Small shaped post, mounted on a wharf or dolphin used to secure ship's lines.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Tie-Up Wall
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A section of wall designated for tying-up vessels awaiting transit. Bollards and mooring devices are available for both large and small ships.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Post or Pile
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A long heavy timber or section of steel, wood, concrete, etc., forced into the seabed to serve as a mooring facility.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Mooring Cable
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A chain or very strong fibre or wire rope used to anchor or moor vessels or buoys.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Mooring Buoy
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A buoy secured to the bottom by permanent moorings with means for mooring a vessel by use of its anchor chain or mooring lines.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of Port Section
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of subdivisions of a port or harbour area by usage.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Port Fairway
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The main navigable channel in a harbour or its approaches, for vessels of larger size.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Berth Pocket
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A body of water at a berth or anchor berth, of adequate dimensions to allow a vessel to make fast to the shore, mooring buoys, berthing dolphins or to anchor.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Seaplane Anchorage
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An area in which sea-planes anchor or may anchor.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Dredged Basin
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An area of water or channel enlargement of increased depth compared to adjacent areas, where the depth is maintained by dredging operations.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Port Safety Zone
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The area around a port facility or harbour installation within which vessels are prohibited from entering without permission.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Lay-by Berth
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A general berth for use by vessels for short term waiting until a loading or discharging berth is available.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of Relationship
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Expresses constraints or requirements on vessel actions or activities in relation to a geographic feature, facility, or service.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Prohibited
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Use of facility, waterway or service is forbidden.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Not Recommended
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Use of facility, waterway or service is not recommended.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Permitted
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Use of facility, waterway, or service is permitted but not required.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Recommended
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Use of facility, waterway, or service is recommended.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Required
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Use of facility, waterway, or service is required.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Not Required
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Use of facility, waterway, or service is not required.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of Schedule
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The type of schedule, for instance opening, closure, etc.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Normal Operation
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The service, office, is open, fully manned, and operating normally, or the area is accessible as usual.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Closure
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The service, office, or area is closed.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Unmanned Operation
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The service is available but not manned.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of Temporal Variation
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: An assessment of the likelihood of change over time.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Extreme Event
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Indication of the possible impact of a significant event (for example hurricane, earthquake, volcanic eruption, landslide, etc), which is considered likely to have changed the seafloor or landscape significantly.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Likely to Change and Significant Shoaling Expected
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Continuous or frequent change (for example river siltation, sand waves, seasonal storms, ice bergs, etc) that is likely to result in new significant shoaling.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Likely to Change But Significant Shoaling Not Expected
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Continuous or frequent change (for example sand wave shift, seasonal storms, ice bergs, etc) that is not likely to result in new significant shoaling.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Likely to Change
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Continuous or frequent change to non-bathymetric features (for example river siltation, glacier creep/recession, sand dunes, buoys, marine farms, etc).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Unlikely to Change
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Significant change to the seafloor is not expected.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Unassessed
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Not having been assessed.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of Text
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of completeness of textual information in relation to the source material from which it is derived.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Abstract or Summary
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A statement summarizing the important points of a text.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Extract
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An excerpt or excerpts from a text.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Full Text
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The whole text.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of Vessel Registry
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The locality of vessel registration or enrolment relative to the nationality of a port, territorial sea, administrative area, exclusive zone or other location.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Domestic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The vessel is registered or enrolled under the same national flag as the port, harbour, territorial sea, exclusive economic zone, or administrative area in which the object that possesses this attribute applies or is located.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Foreign
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The vessel is registered or enrolled under a national flag different from the port, harbour, territorial sea, exclusive economic zone, or other administrative area in which the object that possesses this attribute applies or is located.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Cathodic Protection System
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A system used to protect metal structures against corrosion by supplying direct current to the immersed external surface of the structure.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Cathodic protection is applied to protect harbour installations from corrosion due to seawater, brackish water, saline mud or soil fill.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: City Name
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The name of a town or city.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Communication Channel
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A channel number assigned to a specific radio frequency, frequencies or frequency band.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The expected input is the specific VHF-Channel. The attribute 'communication channel' encodes the various VHF-channels used for communication.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Condition
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The various conditions of buildings and other constructions.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The default 'condition' should be considered to be completed, undamaged and working normally.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Under Construction
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Being built but not yet capable of function.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Ruined
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A structure in a decayed or deteriorated condition resulting from neglect or disuse, or a damaged structure in need of repair.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Under Reclamation
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An area of the sea, a lake or the navigable part of a river that is being reclaimed as land, usually by the dumping of earth and other material.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Planned Construction
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Detailed planning has been completed but construction has not been initiated.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Comparison Operator
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Numerical comparison.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Provides the relation between the value given in the model and the real ship's value.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Greater Than
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The value of the left value is greater than that of the right.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Greater Than or Equal To
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The value of the left expression is greater than or equal to that of the right.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Less Than
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The value of the left expression is less than that of the right.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Less Than or Equal To
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The value of the left expression is less than or equal to that of the right.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Equal To
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The two values are equivalent.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Not Equal To
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The two values are not equivalent.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Contact Instructions
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Instructions provided on how to contact a particular person, organisation or service.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Country Name
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The name of a nation.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Date End
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The latest date on which an object (for example a buoy) will be present.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The Date End should be encoded using 4 digits for the calendar year (YYYY), 2 digits for the month (MM) (for example April = 04) and 2 digits for the day (DD). When no specific month and/or day is required/known, indication of the month and/or day is omitted, and replaced with dashes (-). When no specific year is required (that is, the event or date range ends at the same time each year) the following two cases may be considered:- same day each year: ----MMDD- same month each year: ----MM--This conforms to ISO 8601: 2004. Date End indicates the latest date of an event or the end of a date range. It is used to indicate the end of a fixed date range, the end of a periodic date range, or the removal or cancellation of a feature at a specific date in the future.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Date Fixed
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The date of an event.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Date Start
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The earliest date on which an object (for example a buoy) will be present.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The Date Start should be encoded using 4 digits for the calendar year (YYYY), 2 digits for the month (MM) (for example April = 04) and 2 digits for the day (DD). When no specific month and/or day is required/known, indication of the month and/or day is omitted, and replaced with dashes (-). When no specific year is required (that is, the event or date range ends at the same time each year) the following two cases may be considered:- same day each year: ----MMDD- same month each year: ----MM--This conforms to ISO 8601: 2004. Date Start indicates the earliest date of an event or the start of a date range. It is used to indicate the start of a fixed date range, the start of a periodic date range, or the deployment or implementation of a feature at a specific date in the future.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Date Variable
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A day which is not fixed in the Gregorian calendar.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Examples: The fourth Thursday in November; new moon day of Kartika (Diwali); Easter Sunday.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Day of Week
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Any one of seven days in a week.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Sunday
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The first day of the week.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Monday
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The second day of the week.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Tuesday
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The third day of the week.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Wednesday
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The fourth day of the week.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Thursday
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The fifth day of the week.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Friday
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The sixth day of the week.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Saturday
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The seventh day of the week.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Day of Week is Range
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A statement expressing if the days of the week identified define a range or not.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: A True value is an indication that the identified days of the week define a range between and inclusive of those days.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Delivery Point
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Details of where post can be delivered such as the apartment, name and/or number of a street, building or PO Box.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Development
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Describes a feature that is in development.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Display Name
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A statement expressing if a feature name is to be displayed in certain system display settings or not.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Where it is allowable to encode multiple instances of feature name for a single feature instance, only one feature name instance can indicate that the name is to be displayed (display name set to True).

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Distance
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A numeric measure of the spatial separation between two locations.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Dynamic Resource
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Whether a vessel must use a shore-based or other resource to obtain up-to-date information.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Static
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The information is static, or a source of up-to-date information is unavailable or unknown.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Mandatory External Dynamic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An external source of up-to-date information is available and interaction with it to obtain up-to-date information is required.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Optional External Dynamic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An external source of up-to-date information is available but interaction with it to obtain up-to-date information is not required.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Onboard Dynamic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Up-to-date information may be computed using only onboard resources.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Elevation
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The altitude of the ground level of an object, measured from a specified vertical datum.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Entrance Description
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Description of the seaward end of a channel, harbour, dock, etc.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: File Locator
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The location of a fragment of text or other information in a support file.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Application schemas must describe how the associated file is identified. The associated file will commonly be named in a file reference co-attribute of the same complex attribute. Each DCEG must specify requirements for the format of the associated file and the semantics of file locator. For example, the value of file locator may be an HTML ID in an HTML file, line number in a text file) or a bookmark in a PDF file.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: File Reference
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The file name of an externally referenced text file.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Firefighting Service
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Services for combating fires, provided by different methods.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Shore-Based Firefighting
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Personnel and equipment that are capable of combating a fire from ashore.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Onboard Firefighting
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Trained firefighting personnel with the capability of boarding and combating a fire on a vessel.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Firefighting Boat
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Specialised watercraft with firefighting apparatus designed for fighting shoreline and shipboard fires

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Frequency Shore Station Receives
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The shore station receiver frequency.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Examples:  4379.1 kHz becomes 043791; 13162.8 kHz becomes 131628.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Frequency Shore Station Transmits
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The shore station transmitter frequency.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Examples:  4379.1 kHz becomes 043791; 13162.8 kHz becomes 131628.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: GLN Extension
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The GLN extension component is used to identify internal physical locations within a location which is identified with a GLN. Must conform to the rules for GLN extension. (GS1 specification).

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Headline
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Words set at the head of a passage or page to introduce or categorize.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Global Location Number
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A globally unique, standardised identifier for parties and locations in business processes or supply chains.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Global Location Numbers may be used to identify physical or digital locations, legal entities, organisational subdivisions or departments. A Global Location Number must conform to the GLN format specified in GS1 General Specifications.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Heaving Lines From Shore
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Ships must take heaving lines thrown from the shore.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Some ports make a ship take their heaving line.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Horizontal Distance Uncertainty
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The best estimate of the horizontal accuracy of horizontal clearances and distances.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The error is assumed to be positive and negative. The plus/minus character must not be encoded.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: ID Code
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Identification code as specified in predefined system. Also called identification number.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: In Ballast
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Whether the vessel is in ballast.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: ISPS Level
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of ISPS security levels according to the ISPS Code.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: ISPS Level 1
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The level for which minimum appropriate protective security measures shall be maintained at all times.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: ISPS Level 2
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The level for which appropriate additional protective security measures shall be maintained for a period of time as a result of heightened risk of a security incident.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: ISPS Level 3
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The level for which further specific protective security measures shall be maintained for a limited period of time when a security incident is probable or imminent, although it may not be possible to identify the specific target.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Language
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The method of human communication, either spoken or written, consisting of the use of words in a structured and conventional way.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The language is encoded by a 3 character code following ISO 639-2/T.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Local Knowledge Description
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Description of local knowledge that may be needed, for example to traverse a location.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Location Maritime Resource Name
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Location identifier, based on MRN. This can be either a specific identifier for an identified physical location or a type-only identifier for a logical location, such as BERTH.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Logical Connectives
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Expresses whether all the constraints described by its co-attributes must be satisfied, or only one such constraint need be satisfied.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks:
This attribute is intended to be used with co-attributes that encode limits on vessel dimensions, type of cargo, and other characteristics.
				The combination of constraints described by logicalConnective and its co-attributes defines a subset of vessels to which information described by a feature or information type instance applies (or does not apply, is required, recommended, etc.).
				The relationship between the vessel subset and the information is indicated by an association - see PermissionType and InclusionType).
				The two listed values of logicalConnective are two of the basic operations of Boolean logic. The third basic operation (not) is not used.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Logical Conjunction
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: All the conditions described by the other attributes of the object, or sub-attributes of the same complex attribute, are true.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Logical Disjunction
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: At least one of the conditions described by the other attributes of the object, or sub-attributes of the same complex attributes, is true.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Online Function
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Code for function performed by the online resource.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Download
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: online instructions for transferring data from one storage device or system to another.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Offline Access
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Online instructions for requesting the resource from the provider.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Order
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Online order process for obtaining the resource.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Search
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: To make painstaking investigation or examination.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Complete Metadata
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Complete metadata provided.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Browse Graphic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Browse graphic provided.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Upload
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Online resource upload capability provided.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Email Service
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Online email service provided.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Browsing
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Online browsing provided.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: File Access
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Online file access provided (ISO 19115:2014)

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Online Resource Linkage URL
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Universal Resource Locator of the online resource.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Medical Service
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Services for the prevention or treatment of, or response to injury or illness.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Ambulance
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A vehicle for conveying the sick or injured to or from a hospital.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Fumigation
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Disinfection or purification with fumes.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Doctor
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A place where a doctor is available to provide medical attention.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Quarantine
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The isolation of patients with contagious diseases.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Vaccination Centre
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A place where substances intended to procure immunity against one or several diseases are administered.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Metre Mark Number
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: An identifier for a specific position along a linear or curvilinear extent of a wharf, quay, or jetty. Numbering may be continued over multiple segments.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Manifold Number
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: An identifier for a specific location on a manifold (a pipe or chamber with several openings).

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Maximum Display Scale
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The largest intended viewing scale for the data.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Membership
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Indicates whether a vessel is included or excluded from the regulation/restriction/recommendation/nautical information.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Included
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Vessels with these characteristics are included in the regulation/restriction/recommendation/nautical information

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Excluded
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Vessels with these characteristics are excluded from the regulation/restriction/recommendation/nautical information

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Minimum Berth Depth
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The least depth of the body of water at the berth or in a berth pocket adjacent to the berth.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Method of Securing
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The process, arrangement or scheme of attachment used to secure a vessel to a berth.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Bow to Seaward
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Vessel is secured perpendicular to the wharf with bow to seaward.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Stern to Seaward
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Vessel is secured perpendicular to the wharf with stern to the seaward.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Mediterranean Mooring
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The vessel is secured perpendicular to the wharf.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Baltic Mooring
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Mooring method/procedure used during onshore wind conditions without a tug.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Running Mooring
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Mooring by maneuvering ahead and astern while dropping anchors to secure the vessel with reduced swinging room.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Standing Mooring
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Mooring by using mainly wind and tide to position the vessel while dropping anchors to secure the vessel with reduced swinging room. Makes limited use of the engine to position the vessel.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Single Point Mooring
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A mooring structure used by tankers to load and unload in port approaches or in offshore oil and gas fields. The size of the structure can vary between a large mooring buoy and a manned floating structure.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Conventional Mooring
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Mooring using the vessel's anchors and buoys to secure the vessel at multiple points.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Ship-to-Ship Mooring
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Mooring alongside another vessel.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Spider Buoy Mooring
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Mooring system supported by a spider buoy.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Minimum Display Scale
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The smallest intended viewing scale for the data.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: MMSI Code
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The Maritime Mobile Service Identity (MMSI) Code is formed of a series of nine digits which are transmitted over the radio path in order to uniquely identify ship stations, ship earth stations,coast stations, coast earth stations, and group calls. These identities are formed in such a way that the identity or part thereof can be used by telephone and telex subscribers connected to the general telecommunications network principally to call ships automatically.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Name
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The individual name of a feature.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Name of Resource
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Name of the online resource.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Nationality
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Identifier of membership of a particular nation.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Online Resource Description
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Detailed text description of what the online resource is/does.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Orientation Uncertainty
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The best estimate of the accuracy of a bearing.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Orientation Value
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The angular distance measured from true north to the major axis of the feature.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Pictorial Representation
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Indicates whether a pictorial representation of the feature is available.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The 'pictorial representation' could be a drawing or a photo. The string encodes the file name of an external graphic file (pixel/vector).

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Picture Caption
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Short description of the purpose of the image.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Picture Information
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A set of information to provide credits to picture creator, copyright owner etc.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Port Facility Number
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Number assigned to the port facility in the IMO port facility database.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The IMO port facility number consists of a UN LOCODE with a 4-digit sufffix, seperated by a hyphen, for example USLAX-0001.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Postal Code
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Known in various countries as a postcode, or ZIP code, the postal code is a series of letters and/or digits that identifies each postal delivery area.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Product
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The various substances which are transported, stored or exploited.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Oil
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A thick, slippery liquid that will not dissolve in water, usually petroleum based in the context of storage tanks.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Gas
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A substance with particles that can move freely, usually a fuel substance in the context of storage tanks.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Stone
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A general term for rock and rock fragments ranging in size from pebbles and gravel to boulders or large rock masses.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Coal
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A hard black mineral that is burned as fuel.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Ore
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A solid rock or mineral from which metal is obtained.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Chemicals
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Any substance obtained by or used in a chemical process.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Milk
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A white fluid secreted by female mammals as food for their young.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Bauxite
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A mineral from which aluminum is obtained.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Coke
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A solid substance obtained after gas and tar have been extracted from coal, used as a fuel.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Iron Ingots
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An oblong lump of cast iron metal.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Salt
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Sodium chloride obtained from mines or by the evaporation of sea water.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Sand
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Loose material consisting of small but easily distinguishable, separate grains, between 0.0625 and 2.000 millimetres in diameter.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Timber
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Wood prepared for use in building or carpentry.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Sawdust/Wood Chips
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Powdery fragments of wood made in sawing timber or coarse chips produced for use in manufacturing pressed board.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Scrap Metal
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Discarded metal suitable for being reprocessed.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Liquefied Natural Gas
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Natural gas that has been liquefied for ease of transport by cooling the gas to -162 Celsius.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Liquefied Petroleum Gas
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A compressed gas consisting of flammable light hydrocarbons and derived from petroleum.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Wine
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The fermented juice of grapes.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Cement
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A substance made of powdered lime and clay, mixed with water.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Grain
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A small hard seed, especially that of any cereal plant such as wheat, rice, corn, rye etc.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Protocol
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Connection protocol to be used. Example: ftp, http get KVP, http POST, etc.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Protocol Request
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Request used to access the resource. Structure and content depend on the protocol and standard used by the online resource, such as Web Feature Service standard.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Quality of Horizontal Measurement
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The degree of reliability attributed to a position.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Surveyed
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The position(s) was(were) determined by the operation of making measurements for determining the relative position of points on, above or beneath the earth's surface. Survey implies a regular, controlled survey of any date.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Unsurveyed
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Survey data is does not exist or is very poor.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Inadequately Surveyed
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Not surveyed to modern standards; or due to its age, scale, or positional or vertical uncertainties is not suitable to the type of navigation expected in the area.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Approximate
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A position that is considered to be less than third-order accuracy, but is generally considered to be within 30.5 metres of its correct geographic location. Also may apply to an object whose position does not remain fixed.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Position Doubtful
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Of uncertain position. The expression is used principally on charts to indicate that a wreck, shoal, etc., has been reported in various positions and not definitely determined in any.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Unreliable
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A feature's position has been obtained from questionable or unreliable data.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Reported (Not Surveyed)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An object whose position has been reported and its position confirmed by some means other than a formal survey such as an independent report of the same object.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Reported (Not Confirmed)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An object whose position has been reported and its position has not been confirmed.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Estimated
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The most probable position of an object determined from incomplete data or data of questionable accuracy.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Precisely Known
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A position that is of a known value, such as the position of an anchor berth or other defined object.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Calculated
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A position that is computed from data.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Ramp Number
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: An identifier for a specific ramp (a sloping structure that can be used as a landing place for small vessels, landing ships, or a ferry boat, or for hauling a cradle carrying a vessel, or for the transfer of rolling cargo).

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Repair Service
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Work or maintenance activities whereby vessels or equipment are restored to working order, renovated, or improved in condition.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Compensation of Magnetic Compass
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The process of neutralizing or reducing to a minimum the magnetic effects the vessel itself exerts on a magnetic compass. It is based on the principle that the magnetic effect of the iron and steel of the vessel can be counterbalanced by means of magnets and soft iron placed near the compass. Also called compass adjustment, compass compensation, or magnetic compensation.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Diver Service
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Underwater inspection and repair performed by divers.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Bridge Equipment Repair
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Repairs to eqipment installed on the ship's bridge.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Engine Repair
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Repair of an engine or machine parts.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Electronic Equipment Repair
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Repair of marine electronic instruments.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Hull Repair
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Repairs to the ship's body, frame, or superstructure.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Navigational Equipment Repair
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Repairs to equipment used in the act of navigating a ship.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Propeller Repair
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Repairs to propeller hub and blades.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Salvage Gear Repair
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Repairs to equipment used in salvage operations.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Shaft Repair
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Repairs to drive shafts used for transmitting mechanical power and torque to a propeller.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Reported Date
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The date that the item was observed, done, or investigated.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: SMDG Terminal Code
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A code from the SMDG (Ship Message Design Group) Terminal Code List.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Scale Minimum
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The minimum scale at which the feature may be used for example for ECDIS presentation.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The modulus of the scale is indicated, that is 1:1 250 000 is encoded as 1250000.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Security-Safety-Emergency Service
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Protective services, law enforcement, or services for responding to sudden danger.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: codelistType=openEnumeration

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Coast Guard
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Organization keeping watch on shipping and coastal waters according to governmental law; normally the authority with responsibility for search and rescue.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Customs
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The agency or establishment for collecting duties, tolls.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Environmental Emergency Information Centre
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Office for reporting or obtaining information about sudden dangers to the environment such as spillage of polluting or hazardous substances.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Emergency Coordination Centre
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An office or organisation for reporting or coordinating response to emergencies.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Guard and/or Security Service
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A place where a vessel is patrolled by a security service or stored in a secure lockup.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Immigration
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The authority controlling people entering a country.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Police
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The department of government, or civil force, charged with maintaining public order.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Sea Rescue Control
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A unit responsible for promoting efficient organization of search and rescue services and for coordinating the conduct of search and rescue operations within a search and rescue region.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Sector Bearing
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A sector is the part of a circle between two straight lines drawn from the centre to the circumference. Sector bearing specifies the limit of the sector.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The values given to the common limits of adjacent sectors should be identical. The orientation of bearing is from seaward to the central object. This conforms with the method used in 'List of Lights' publications. A generic term such as 'to shore' cannot be used; a specific bearing must be encoded. Where a light sector limit is defined as 'to the shore', it should be encoded using a value that ensures that, when the limit is drawn, it will fall entirely on land.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Ship Sanitation Control
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Application of measures to ensure that a vessel is free of disease and disease risks, or issue of completion or exemption certificates for such measures.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Sanitation Measures Only
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Capable of applying measures to ensure that a vessel is free of disease and disease risks, but cannot issue a certificate.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Issue SSCC
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The competent authority can issue a Ship Sanitation Control Certificate after satisfactorily completing or supervising the completion of ship sanitation control measures.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Issue SSCEC
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The competent authority may issue a Ship Sanitation Control Exemption Certificate if it is satisfied that the ship is free of infection and contamination, including vectors and reservoirs.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Signal Frequency
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The frequency of a signal.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Sill Depth
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The greatest depth over a sill.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Source
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The publication, document, or reference work from which information comes or is acquired.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: May be populated with the corresponding paper chart Notice to Mariners numbers, although other references are permitted.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Source Date
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The production date of the source; for example the date of measurement.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Source Type
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Type of the source.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Law or Regulation
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Treaty, convention, or international agreement; law or regulation issued by a national or other authority.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Official Publication
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Publication not having the force of law, issued by an international organisation or a national or local administration.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Mariner Report, Confirmed
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Reported by mariner(s) and confirmed by another source.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Mariner Report, Not Confirmed
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Reported by mariner(s) but not confirmed.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Industry Publications and Reports
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Shipping and other industry publications, including graphics, charts and web sites.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Remotely Sensed Images
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Information obtained from satellite images.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Photographs
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Information obtained from photographs.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Products Issued by HO Services
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Information obtained from products issued by Hydrographic Offices.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: News Media
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Information obtained from news media.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Traffic Data
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Information obtained from the analysis of traffic data.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Supply Service
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of services for the provision of materials, goods, utilities, or personal services to vessels, passengers, or crew.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Describes an enumeration or codelist listing specific services.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Shore Power
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The provision of shoreside electrical power to a ship at berth while its main and auxiliary engines are shut down.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Fuel Oil Bunkering
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Transfer of fuel oil to the fuel compartments of a ship.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: LNG Bunkering
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Transfer of liquefied natural gas to the fuel compartments of a ship.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Lubricants
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Substances capable of reducing friction, heat, and wear when introduced as a film between solid surfaces.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Steam
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The gas into which water is changed by boiling.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Potable Water
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Water which can be used for drinking and food preparation.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: International Shore Connection
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A universal hose connection for the supply of water for fighting fires.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Provisions
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A place where food and other such supplies are available.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Chandler
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A dealer in ships' supplies.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Mechanics Workshop
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A place where mechanical repairs can be undertaken to engines or other vessel equipment.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Technical Port Service
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Services for the adjustment of vessel equipment or for assessments pertaining to cargo, compliance with regulations, safety, or security.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Compensation of Magnetic Compass
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The process of neutralizing or reducing to a minimum the magnetic effects the vessel itself exerts on a magnetic compass. It is based on the principle that the magnetic effect of the iron and steel of the vessel can be counterbalanced by means of magnets and soft iron placed near the compass. Also called compass adjustment, compass compensation, or magnetic compensation.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Degaussing
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Neutralization of the strength of the magnetic field of a vessel, by means of suitably arranged electric coils permanently installed in the vessel. See also Degaussing Cable.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Cargo Surveying
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Inspection, evaluation or monitoring of the quantity, stowage, loading and unloading, and condition of cargo, and the effects of cargoes on vessel stability and safety.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Vetting
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Assessment of quality and compliance with applicable law, regulations, and safety standards.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Telecommunication Identifier
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: An identifier, such as words, numbers, letters, symbols, or any combination of those used to establish a contact to a particular person, organisation or service.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Telecommunication Carrier
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The name of a provider or type of carrier for a telecommunication service. This service may include land line based, shore based or satellite based radio connections.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Telecommunication Service
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of methods of communication over a distance by electrical, electronic, or electromagnetic means.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Voice
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The transfer or exchange of information by using sounds that are being made by mouth and throat when speaking.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Facsimile
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A system of transmitting and reproducing graphic matter (as printing or still pictures) by means of signals sent over telephone lines.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: SMS
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Short Message Service is a form of text messaging communication on phones and mobile phones.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Data
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A representation of facts, concepts or instructions in a formalised manner suitable for communication, interpretation or processing.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Streamed Data
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Data that is constantly received by and presented to an end-user while being delivered by a provider.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Telex
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A system of communication in which messages are sent over long distances by using a telephone system and are printed by using a special machine (called a teletypewriter).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Telegraph
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An apparatus, system or process for communication at a distance by electric transmission over wire.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Email
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Messages and other data exchanged between individuals using computers in a network.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Terminal Identifier
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The unique identifier for a given terminal.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Text
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A non-formatted digital text string.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Should be used, for example, to hold the information that is for short cautionary or explanatory notes. Therefore, text populated in text must not exceed 300 characters. Text may be in English, or in a national language. No formatting of text is possible within text. If formatted text, or text strings exceeding 300 characters, is required, then an alternate concept should be used.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Text Justification
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The anchor point of a text string.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Left
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Of, relating to, or located on or near the side of a person or thing that is turned toward the west when the subject is facing north (opposed to right).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Centred
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Equidistant from all bordering or adjacent areas; situated in the centre.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Right
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Of, relating to, or located on or near the side of a person or thing that is turned toward the east when the subject is facing north (opposed to left).

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Text Offset Mm
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The distance in millimetres that text associated with a feature is positioned from the feature in an end-user system.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Text Type
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The attribute from which a text string is derived.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Name
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The individual name of a feature.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Thickness of Ice Capability
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The thickness of ice that the ship can safely transit.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Time of Day End
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The time corresponding to the end of an active period.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The time of day end must be encoded using 2 digits for the hour (hh), 2 digits for the minutes(mm) and 2 digits for the seconds (ss). This conforms to ISO 8601:2004.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Time of Day Start
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The time corresponding to the start of an active period.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The time of day start must be encoded using 2 digits for the hour (hh), 2 digits for the minutes(mm) and 2 digits for the seconds (ss). This conforms to ISO 8601:2004.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Transport Connection
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of services for the conveyance of persons and/or goods, according to means of transport, nature of path, or representative installation.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: codelistType=openEnumeration

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Heliport
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A small airport for the use of helicopters and some other vertical lift aircraft. Heliports typically contain one or more touchdown and liftoff areas and also have facilities such as fuel or hangars. In some larger towns and cities, customs facilities may also be available.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Helipad
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A small landing surface for helicopters, with minimal or no supporting installations or facilities.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Hired Boat
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Small boat with crew that may be hired for single journeys.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Bus Station
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A building where buses and coaches regularly stop to take on and/or let off passengers, especially for long-distance travel.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Ferry
