S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A vessel for transporting passengers, vehicles, and/or goods across a stretch of water, especially as a regular service.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Motorway
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A limited access dual carriageway road specially designed for fast long-distance traffic and subject to special regulations concerning its use. It may have more than two lanes.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Launch
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Large open or half decked boat.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Inland Waterway Transport
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The carriage of goods or passengers using navigable waterways such as canals, rivers, lakes, or other stretch of water that is not part of the sea.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Short Sea Transportation
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The carriage of specified types of cargo between qualifying ports. The types of cargo and/or qualifying ports are generally specified by law or government regulation.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Marine Highway
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Specially designated commercially navigable routes in coastal, inland, and intracoastal waters, frequently as waterborne relievers to congested landside routes.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Tug Information
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Textual description of the types and capacities of available tugs.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Uncertainty Fixed
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The best estimate of the fixed horizontal or vertical accuracy component for positions, depths, heights, vertical distances and vertical clearances.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Uncertainty Variable Factor
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The factor to be applied to the variable component of an uncertainty equation so as to provide the best estimate of the variable horizontal or vertical accuracy component for positions, depths, heights, vertical distances and vertical clearances.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: UN Location Code
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Used to encode the UN Location Code (http://www.unece.org/cefact/locode/service/location.html) or - in Europe - the Inland Ship Reporting Standard (ISRS) Code.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Vertical Clearance Value
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The vertical clearance measured from the horizontal plane towards the feature overhead.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Vertical Datum
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The reference level used for expressing the vertical measurements of points on the earth's surface. Also called datum level, reference plane, levelling datum, datum for sounding reduction, datum for heights.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Mean Low Water Springs
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The average height of the low waters of spring tides. This level is used as a tidal datum in some areas. Also called spring low water.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Mean Lower Low Water Springs
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The average height of lower low water springs at a place.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Mean Sea Level
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The average height of the surface of the sea at a tide station for all stages of the tide over a 19-year period, usually determined from hourly height readings measured from a fixed predetermined reference level.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Lowest Low Water
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An arbitrary level conforming to the lowest tide observed at a place, or some what lower.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Mean Low Water
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The average height of all low waters at a place over a 19-year period.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Lowest Low Water Springs
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An arbitrary level conforming to the lowest water level observed at a place at spring tides during a period of time shorter than 19 years.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Approximate Mean Low Water Springs
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An arbitrary level, usually within 0.3m from that of Mean Low Water Springs (MLWS).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Indian Spring Low Water
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An arbitrary tidal datum approximating the level of the mean of the lower low water at spring tides. It was first used in waters surrounding India.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Low Water Springs
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An arbitrary level, approximating that of mean low water springs (MLWS).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Approximate Lowest Astronomical Tide
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An arbitrary level, usually within 0.3m from that of Lowest Astronomical Tide (LAT).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Nearly Lowest Low Water
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An arbitrary level approximating the lowest water level observed at a place, usually equivalent to the Indian Spring Low Water (ISLW).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Mean Lower Low Water
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The average height of the lower low waters at a place over a 19-year period.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Low Water
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The lowest level reached at a place by the water surface in one oscillation. Also called low tide.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Approximate Mean Low Water
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An arbitrary level, usually within 0.3m from that of Mean Low Water (MLW).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Approximate Mean Lower Low Water
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An arbitrary level, usually within 0.3m from that of Mean Lower Low Water (MLLW).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Mean High Water
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The average height of all high waters at a place over a 19-year period.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Mean High Water Springs
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The average height of the high waters of spring tides. Also called spring high water.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: High Water
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The highest level reached at a place by the water surface in one oscillation.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Approximate Mean Sea Level
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An arbitrary level, usually within 0.3m from that of Mean Sea Level (MSL).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: High Water Springs
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An arbitrary level, approximating that of mean high water springs (MHWS).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Mean Higher High Water
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The average height of higher high waters at a place over a 19-year period.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Equinoctial Spring Low Water
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The level of low water springs near the time of an equinox.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Lowest Astronomical Tide
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The lowest tide level which can be predicted to occur under average meteorological conditions and under any combination of astronomical conditions.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Local Datum
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An arbitrary datum defined by a local harbour authority, from which levels and tidal heights are measured by this authority.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: International Great Lakes Datum 1985
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A vertical reference system with its zero based on the mean water level at Rimouski/Pointe-au-Pere, Quebec, over the period 1970 to 1988.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Mean Water Level
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The average of all hourly water levels over the available period of record.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Lower Low Water Large Tide
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The average of the lowest low waters, one from each of 19 years of observations.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Higher High Water Large Tide
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The average of the highest high waters, one from each of 19 years of observations.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Nearly Highest High Water
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An arbitrary level approximating the highest water level observed at a place, usually equivalent to the high water springs.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Highest Astronomical Tide
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The highest tidal level which can be predicted to occur under average meteorological conditions and under any combination of astronomical conditions.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Baltic Sea Chart Datum 2000
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The datum refers to each Baltic country's realization of the European Vertical Reference System (EVRS) with land-uplift epoch 2000, which is connected to the Normaal Amsterdams Peil (NAP).

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Vessels Characteristics
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Characteristics of vessels.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Length Overall
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The maximum length of the ship.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Length at Waterline
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The ship's length measured at the waterline.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Breadth
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The width or beam of the vessel.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Draught
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The depth of water necessary to float a vessel fully loaded.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Displacement Tonnage
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A measurement of the weight of the vessel, usually used for warships. (Merchant ships are usually measured based on the volume of cargo space; see tonnage). Displacement is expressed either in long tons of 2,240 pounds or metric tonnes of 1,000 kg. Since the two units are very close in size (2,240 pounds = 1,016 kg and 1,000 kg = 2,205 pounds), it is common not to distinguish between them. To preserve secrecy, nations sometimes misstate a warship's displacement.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Displacement Tonnage, Light
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The weight of the ship excluding cargo, fuel, ballast, stores, passengers, and crew, but with water in the boilers to steaming level.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Displacement Tonnage, Loaded
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The weight of the ship including cargo, passengers, fuel, water, stores, dunnage and such other items necessary for use on a voyage, which brings the vessel down to her load draft.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Deadweight Tonnage
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The difference between displacement, light and displacement, loaded. A measure of the ship's total carrying capacity.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Gross Tonnage
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The entire internal cubic capacity of the ship expressed in tons of 100 cubic feet to the ton, except certain spaces with are exempted such as: peak and other tanks for water ballast, open forecastle bridge and poop, access of hatchways, certain light and air spaces, domes of skylights, condenser, anchor gear, steering gear, wheel house, galley and cabin for passengers.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Net Tonnage
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Obtained from the gross tonnage by deducting crew and navigating spaces and allowances for propulsion machinery.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Panama Canal/Universal Measurement System Net Tonnage
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The Panama Canal/Universal Measurement System (PC/UMS) is based on net tonnage, modified for Panama Canal purposes. PC/UMS is based on a mathematical formula to calculate a vessel's total volume; a PC/UMS net ton is equivalent to 100 cubic feet of capacity.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Suez Canal Net Tonnage
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The Suez Canal Net Tonnage (SCNT) is derived with a number of modifications from the former net register tonnage of the Moorsom System and was established by the International Commission of Constantinople in its Protocol of 18 December 1873. It is still in use, as amended by the Rules of Navigation of the Suez Canal Authority, and is registered in the Suez Canal Tonnage Certificate.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Vessels Characteristics Unit
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The unit used for vessel characteristics attribute.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Metric Ton
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The tonne or metric ton (U.S.), often redundantly referred to as a metric tonne, is a unit of mass equal to 1,000 kg (2,205 lb) or approximately the mass of one cubic metre of water at four degrees Celsius. It is sometimes abbreviated as mt in the United States, but this conflicts with other SI symbols. The tonne is not a unit in the International System of Units (SI), but is accepted for use with the SI. In SI units and prefixes, the tonne is a megagram (Mg). The Imperial and US customary units comparable to the tonne are both spelled ton in English, though they differ in mass. Pronunciation of tonne (the word used in the UK) and ton is usually identical, but is not too confusing unless accuracy is important as the tonne and UK long ton differ by only 1.6.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Ton
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Long ton (weight ton or imperial ton) is the name for the unit called the "ton" in the avoirdupois or Imperial system of measurements, as used in the United Kingdom and several other Commonwealth countries. It has been mostly replaced by the tonne, and in the United States by the short ton. One long ton is equal to 2,240 pounds (1,016 kg) or 35 cubic feet (0.9911 m) of salt water with a density of 64 lb/ft (1.025 g/ml). It has some limited use in the United States, most commonly in measuring the displacement of ships, and was the unit prescribed for warships by the Washington Naval Treaty for example battleships were limited to a mass of 35,000 long tons (36,000 t; 39,000 ST).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Short Ton
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A unit of weight equal to 2,000 pounds (907.18474 kg). In the United States it is often called simply ton without distinguishing it from the metric ton (tonne, 1,000 kilograms) or the long ton (2,240 pounds / 1,016.0469088 kilograms); rather, the other two are specifically noted. There are, however, some US applications for which unspecified tons normally means long tons (for example, Navy ships) or metric tons (world grain production figures). Both the long and short ton are defined as 20 hundredweights, but a hundredweight is 100 pounds (45.359237 kg) in the US system (short or net hundredweight) and 112 pounds (50.80234544 kg) in the Imperial system (long or gross hundredweight).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Gross Ton
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Gross tonnage (GT) is a function of the volume of all ship's enclosed spaces (from keel to funnel) measured to the outside of the hull framing. There is a sliding scale factor. So GT is a kind of capacity-derived index that is used to rank a ship for purposes of determining manning, safety and other statutory requirements and is expressed simply as GT, which is a unitless entity, even though its derivation is tied to the cubic meter unit of volumetric capacity.Tonnage measurements are now governed by an IMO Convention (International Convention on Tonnage Measurement of Ships, 1969 (London-Rules)), which applies to all ships built after July 1982. In accordance with the Convention, the correct term to use now is GT, which is a function of the moulded volume of all enclosed spaces of the ship.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Net Ton
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Net tonnage (NT) is based on a calculation of the volume of all cargo spaces of the ship. It indicates a vessels earning space and is a function of the moulded volume of all cargo spaces of the ship.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Suez Canal Net Tonnage
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The Suez Canal Net Tonnage (SCNT) is derived with a number of modifications from the former net register tonnage of the Moorsom System and was established by the International Commission of Constantinople in its Protocol of 18 December 1873. It is still in use, as amended by the Rules of Navigation of the Suez Canal Authority, and is registered in the Suez Canal Tonnage Certificate.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Vessels Characteristics Value
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The value of a particular characteristic such as a dimension or tonnage of a vessel.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Examples: VSLVAL = 12.345 + VSLCAR = 4 (draught) = draught of 12.345 VSLUNT = 1 (m); VSLVAL = 12345 + VSLCAR = 11 (net tonnage) = net tonnage of 12345 VSLUNT = 7 (net ton (NT)); VSLVAL = 123.45 + VSLCAR = 1 (length overall) = length overall of 123.45 VSLUNT = 1 (m).

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Vessel Performance
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A description of the required handling characteristics of a vessel including hull design, main and auxiliary machinery, cargo handling equipment, navigation equipment and manoeuvring behaviour.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Waste Disposal Service
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Service for the reception of residues, polluting substances, refuse, oily wastes, and by-products from ships.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: MARPOL Annex I Oily Bilge Water
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The service with facility to receive oil related waste/residue of the type "Oily bilge water" as specified in MARPOL Annex I.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: MARPOL Annex I Oily Residues
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The service with facility to receive oil related waste/residue of the type "Oily Residues (sludge)" as specified in MARPOL Annex I.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: MARPOL Annex I Oily Tank Washings
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The service with facility to receive oil related waste/residue of the type "Oily tank washings (slops)" as specified in MARPOL Annex I.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: MARPOL Annex I Dirty Ballast Water
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The service with facility to receive oil related waste/residue of the type "Dirty ballast water" as specified in MARPOL Annex I.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: MARPOL Annex I Scale and Sludge from Tank Cleaning
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The service with facility to receive oil related waste/residue of the type "Scale and sludge from tank cleaning" as specified in MARPOL Annex I.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: MARPOL Annex I Other Oily Waste
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The service with facility to receive oil related waste/residue of the type "Other" as specified in MARPOL Annex I.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: MARPOL Annex II Category X
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The service with facility to receive chemical/Noxious liquid substances related waste/residue of the type "Category X" as specified in MARPOL Annex II.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: MARPOL Annex II Category Y
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The service with facility to receive chemical/Noxious liquid substances related waste/residue of the type "Category Y" as specified in MARPOL Annex II.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: MARPOL Annex II Category Z
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The service with facility to receive chemical/Noxious liquid substances related waste/residue of the type "Category Z" as specified in MARPOL Annex II.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: MARPOL Annex II Category OS
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The service with facility to receive chemical/Noxious liquid substances related waste/residue of the type "Other substance" as specified in MARPOL Annex II.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: MARPOL Annex IV Sewage
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The service with facility to receive waste/residue of the type "Sewage" as specified in MARPOL Annex IV.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: MARPOL Annex V Plastics
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The service with facility to receive garbage related waste/residue of the type "Plastics", as specified in MARPOL Annex V

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: MARPOL Annex V Food Wastes
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The service with facility to receive garbage related waste/residue of the type "Food wastes", as specified in MARPOL Annex V

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: MARPOL Annex V Domestic Wastes
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The service with facility to receive garbage related waste/residue of the type "Domestic wastes", as specified in MARPOL Annex V

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: MARPOL Annex V Cooking Oil
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The service with facility to receive garbage related waste/residue of the type "Cooking oil", as specified in MARPOL Annex V

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: MARPOL Annex V Incinerator Ashes
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The service with facility to receive garbage related waste/residue of the type "Incinerator ashes", as specified in MARPOL Annex V

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: MARPOL Annex V Operational Wastes
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The service with facility to receive garbage related waste/residue of the type "Operational wastes", as specified in MARPOL Annex V

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: MARPOL Annex V Animal Carcasses
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The service with facility to receive garbage related waste/residue of the type "Animal carcasses", as specified in MARPOL Annex V

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: MARPOL Annex V Fishing Gear
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The service with facility to receive garbage related waste/residue of the type "Fishing gear", as specified in MARPOL Annex V

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: MARPOL Annex V E-Waste
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The service with facility to receive garbage related waste/residue of the type "E-waste", as specified in MARPOL Annex V

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: MARPOL Annex V Cargo Residues - non-HME
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The service with facility to receive garbage related waste/residue of the type "Cargo residues not determined to be harmful to the marine environment", as specified in MARPOL Annex V

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: MARPOL Annex V Cargo Residues - HME
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The service with facility to receive garbage related waste/residue of the type "Cargo residues harmful to the marine environment", as specified in MARPOL Annex V

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: MARPOL Annex VI Ozone-Depleting Substances
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The service with facility to receive air pollution related waste/residue of the type "Ozone-depleting substances" as specified in MARPOL Annex VI.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: MARPOL Annex VI Exhaust Gas-Cleaning Residues
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The service with facility to receive air pollution related waste/residue of the type "Exhaust gas-cleaning residues" as specified in MARPOL Annex VI.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Action or Activity
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The action or activity of a vessel.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: codeListType=open enumeration; encoding=other: [something]

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Navigating With a Pilot
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Carrying a qualified pilot as part of the vessel navigation team.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Entering Port
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Navigating a vessel into a port.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Leaving Port
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Navigating a vessel out of a port.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Berthing
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Attaching a vessel to a wharf or jetty.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Slipping
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Detaching a vessel from a wharf or jetty.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Anchoring
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Attaching a vessel to the seabed by means of an anchor and cable.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Weighing Anchor
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Detaching a vessel from the seabed by recovering an anchor and cable.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Transiting
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Navigating a vessel along a route or through a narrow gap, such as under a bridge or through a lock.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Overtaking
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Navigating a vessel past another traveling broadly in the same direction.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Reporting
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Providing details such as the name, location or intentions of a vessel.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Working Cargo
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Loading or unloading cargo.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Landing
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Placing crew or passengers on shore.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Diving
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A signal or message warning of diving activity.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Fishing
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Hunting or catching fish.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Discharging Overboard
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Releasing anything into the sea; often ballast water; or spoil from dredging elsewhere.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Passing
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Navigating a vessel past another travelling broadly in the opposite direction.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of RxN
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The principal subject matter of regulations, restrictions, recommendations or nautical information.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: codeListType=open enumeration; encoding=other: [something]

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Navigation
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The process of directing the movement of a craft from one point to another.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Communication
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Transmitting and/or receiving electronic communication signals.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Environmental Protection
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Pertaining to environmental protection.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Wildlife Protection
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Pertaining to wildlife protection.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Security
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Pertaining to security.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Customs
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The agency or establishment for collecting duties, tolls.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Cargo Operation
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Pertaining to cargo operations.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Refuge
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Pertaining to a place of safety or refuge.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Health
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The authority with responsibility for checking the validity of the health declaration of a vessel and for declaring free pratique.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Natural Resources or Exploitation
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Pertaining to natural resources or exploitation.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Port
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Person or corporation, owners of, or entrusted with or invested with the power of managing a port. May be called a Harbour Board, Port Trust, Port Commission, Harbour Commission, Marine Department.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Finance
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An authority with responsibility for the control and movement of money.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Agriculture
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The science, art, or practice of cultivating the soil, producing crops, and raising livestock and in varying degrees the preparation and marketing of the resulting products.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of Vessel
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of vessels by function or use.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: codeListType=open enumeration; encoding=other: [something]

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: General Cargo Vessel
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A vessel which is designed for carrying general cargo, e.g. boxes, sacks.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Container Carrier
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a vessel designed to carry ISO containers.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Tanker
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A vessel which is designed for carrying liquid goods, for example oil or water.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Bulk Carrier
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A vessel which is designed for carrying bulk goods, e.g. coal, ore or grain.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Passenger Vessel
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A day trip or cabin vessel constructed and equipped to carry more than 12 passengers.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Roll-On Roll-Off
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A vessel designed to allow road vehicles to be driven on and off; often a ferry.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Refrigerated Cargo Vessel
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A vessel designed to carry refrigerated cargo.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Fishing Vessel
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A vessel that is used and equipped for the fishing of living aquatic resources.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Service
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A vessel which provides a service such as a tug, anchor handler, survey or supply vessel.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Warship
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A vessel designed for the conduct of military operations.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Towed or Pushed Composite Unit
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Either a tug and tow, or any combination of a tug providing propulsion to barges or vessels secured ahead or alongside.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Tug and Tow
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A combination of tug(s) and non-powered tow(s).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Light Recreational
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A pleasure boat or watercraft, or an excursion vessel used for short cruises such as whale watching.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Semi-Submersible Offshore Installation
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An installation which is designed to float at all times and which is normally anchored in position when deployed in the offshore gas and oil industry.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Jack-Up Exploration or Project Installation
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An exploration or project installation with legs which can be raised and lowered. The legs are raised when the installation is re-positioned. When stationary the legs are lowered to the sea floor and the working platform is raised clear of the sea surface.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Livestock Carrier
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A vessel designed to carry large quantities of live animals.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Sport Fishing
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A vessel used in fishing for pleasure or competition.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Location by Text
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A textual rendering of a geographic location.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Bearing Information
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: A bearing is the direction one object is from another object.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Cargo Services Description
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: Description of services related to the goods or items carried by vessels.
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Textual or narrative description of cargo services.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Construction Information
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: A description of construction or other development in a location where the work will affect vessel operations such as navigation, maneuvering or docking/berthing.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Contact Address
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: Direction or superscription of a letter, package, etc., specifying the name of the place to which it is directed, and optionally a contact person or organisation who should receive it.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Depths Description
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: Textual description of the characteristics and notable matters pertaining to depths in an area.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Facilities Layout Description
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: Textual description of the layout of port facilities.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Feature Name
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: Provides the name of an entity, defines the national language of the name, and provides the option to display the name at various system display settings.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Fixed DDate RRange
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: An active period of a single fixed event or occurrence, as the date range between discrete start and end dates.
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The sub-attributes date start and date end must be encoded using 4 digits for the calendar year (YYYY) and, optionally, 2 digits for the month (MM) (e.g. April = 04) and 2 digits for the day (DD). When no specific month and/or day is required/known, the values are replaced with dashes (-).

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Frequency Pair
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: A pair of frequencies for transmitting and receiving radio signals. The shore station transmits and receives on the frequencies indicated.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: General Harbour Information
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: General information about the port or harbour area.
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Describes a collection of information designed to give a general overview of harbour related Information.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: General Port Description
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: General, introductory information about the port.
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:remarks: General statement about the port, including social/political aspects, which could have an impact on the mariner’s/company’s safety or professional reputation. The information covered by this should be confined to information not contained in any other place in the data.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Graphic
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: Pictorial information such as a photograph, sketch or other graphic, optionally accompanied by descriptive information about the graphic and the location relative to its subject from which it was made.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Horizontal Position Uncertainty
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The best estimate of the accuracy of a position.
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The expected input is the maximum of the two-dimensional error. The error is assumed to be positive and negative.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Information
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: Textual information about the feature. The information may be provided as a string of text or as a file name of a single external text file that contains the text.
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:remarks: At least one of the sub-attributes file reference or text must be populated.The sub-attribute file reference is generally used for long text strings or those that require formatting, however, there is no restriction on the type of text (except for lexical level) that can be held in files referenced by sub-attribute file reference.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Landmark Description
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: Textual description of selected landmarks that have significance in an area.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Limits Description
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: Description of the area covered by the information specified.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Major Light Description
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: A description of navigationally significant lights essential for marking landfalls, offshore dangers, shipping routes, port access channels or protection of the marine environment.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Marked By
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: Description of the aids to navigation used to mark an area or object.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Online Resource
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: Information about online sources from which a resource or data can be obtained.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Offshore Mark Description
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: Description of aids to navigation or prominent marks located away from the shore.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Orientation
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: (1) The angular distance measured from true north to the major axis of the feature. (2) In ECDIS, the mode in which information on the ECDIS is being presented. Typical modes include: north-up - as shown on a nautical chart, north is at the top of the display; Ships head-up - based on the actual heading of the ship, (e.g. Ships gyrocompass); course-up display - based on the course or route being taken.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Schedule by Day of Week
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The nature and timings of a daily schedule by days of the week.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Periodic Date Range
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The active period of a recurring event or occurrence.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: RxN Code
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: A summary of the impact of the most common types of regulation, restriction, recommendation and nautical information on a vessel.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Spatial Accuracy
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: Provides an indication of the vertical and horizontal positional uncertainty of bathymetric data, optionally within a specified date range.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Survey Date Range
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The complex attribute describes the period of the hydrographic survey, as the time between its sub-attributes.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Telecommunications
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: A means or channel of communicating at a distance by electrical or electromagnetic means such as telegraphy, telephony, or broadcasting.
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:remarks: If no value is populated for the sub-attribute telecommunication service, this means the service is by voice communication. If no value is populated for the sub-attribute telecommunication carrier, this means the service is by land line communication.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Text Content
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: Textual material, or a pointer to a resource providing textual material. May be accompanied by basic information about its source and relationship to the source.
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Exactly one of sub-attributes onlineResource or information must be completed in one instance of textContent. Product specifications may restrict the use or content of onlineResource for security. For example, a product specification may forbid populating onlineResource. Product specification authors must consider whether applications using the data product may be prevented from accessing off-system resources by security policies.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Time Intervals by Day of Week
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The regular weekly operation times of a service or schedule.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Useful Mark Description
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: Description of Aids to Navigation or prominent marks which are usually clearly visible and identifiable enough to be used in determining location or direction.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Vessels Measurements
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: Values, discovered by measuring, that correspond to vessels characteristics.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Weather Resource
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: Links for relevant weather related information.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Vertical Uncertainty
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The best estimate of the vertical accuracy of depths, heights, vertical distances and vertical clearances.
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Encodes the vertical uncertainty associated with any vertical measurement.

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Component of
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: A pointer to the aggregate in a whole-part relationship.

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Constitute
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: Reference to a whole of the same type as the part feature in the relationship.

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: The applicable RxN
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: The applicable regulation, restriction, recommendation or nautical information

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Applies in location
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: The location in which the information item applies

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Authority (reference)
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: A pointer to an Authority object

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Authority service hours
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: The authority for which service hours are given

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Contact details (reference)
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: A pointer to an Contact Details object

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Auxiliary Facility
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: A refernce to a feature that supplements or supports the use of the primary feature in an AuxiliaryFacility relationship.

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Control authority
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: The controlling organization or authority for a geographically located service

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Controlled service
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: The service controlled by an organisation or authority

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Defined for
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: A pointer to a specific spatial type(s).

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Defines
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: A pointer to an information type providing spatial quality information.

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Demarcated Feature
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: Reference to the feature within which locations are demarcated.

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Demarcation Indicator
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: Reference to a feature demarcating a location within another feature.

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Entrance Reference
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: Reference to an information type describing the entrance to a limit area.

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Entrance To
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: A reference to the feature to which entrance information pertains.

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Has Infrastructure
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: Reference to the feature describing a particular instance of physical infrastructure.

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Identifies
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: A pointer to a specific feature(s).

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Infrastructure Location
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: Reference to the feature within which the infrastructure is located.

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Information provided for
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: A pointer to a specific feature(s) for which further information is required.

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Is applicable to
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: The object or class of objects to which the regulation, restriction, recommendation, or nautical information applies

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Limit Extent
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: Reference to a feature demarcating the extent to which a coastal State claims or may claim a specific jurisdiction.

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Limit Reference
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: Reference to the feature for which a coastal State claims a specific jurisdiction different from the feature's geographic boundary.

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Location service hours
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: Reference to the location for which service hours are given.

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Layout Unit
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: A reference to the diverse units comprising a feature of a different type.

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Location Served
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: Reference to the location (feature) where specified services are available.

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Facility Operating Hours
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: Reference to information about the days and times during which a facility operates or may be used.

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Partial working day
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: The work hours for a non-standard workday

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Permission
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: The permissions for a location

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Positions
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: A pointer to a specific cartographically positioned location for text.

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Primary Facility
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: A reference to the primary feature in an Auxiliaryfacility relationship.

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Provides information
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: A pointer to an object that provides more information about the referencing feature or information type.

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Service Description Reference
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: Reference to an information object describing services.

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: The information
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: Information related to an organisation

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: The organisation
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: The organisation to which information relates

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: The RxN
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: The regulation, restriction, recommendation, or nautical information

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Service Hours (reference)
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: Service hours for an authority or service provider

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: The service hours for a non-standard workday
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: The usual service hours to which an exception applies

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Service place
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: Pointer to service or facility
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:remarks: Distinction: serviceArea (area served by a provider)

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Sub-Unit
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: Reference to a part of the same type as the whole feature in the relationship.

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Vessel location
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: The location to which the permission statement applies
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:remarks: Implementations must use between Applicability and PermissionType objects, not to feature instance. The PermissionType->feature link is via a generic inverse association

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:name: Additional Information
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:definition: A feature association for the binding between at least one instance of a geo feature and an instance of an information type.
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:remarks: Role informationProvidedFor encodable only as a generic inverse association in feature objects in 3.0.0 datasets

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:name: Associated RxN
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:definition: Association between a geographic location and a regulation, restriction, recommendation, or nautical information
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:remarks: Role appliesInLocation encodable only as a generic inverse association in 3.0.0 datasets as it is an information->feature link

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:name: Exceptional Workday
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:definition: Exception to the usual working day

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:name: Inclusion Type
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:definition: Association class specifying the relationship between the subset of vessels described by an APPLIC data object and a regulation (restriction, recommendation, or nautical information).

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:name: Limit Entrance
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:definition: Association between a limit feature and the entrance for the limit.

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:name: Permission Type
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:definition: Association class for associations describing whether the subsets of vessels determined by the ship characteristics specified in APPLIC may (or must, etc.) transit,  enter, or use  a feature.

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:name: Service Contact
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:definition: Contact details for a service or facility

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:name: Service Control
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:definition: Association between a geographically located service and the organisation that controls it
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:remarks: This is an information association linking a location where a service is provided with an information type describing the provider. Contrast to serviceProvisionArea, which is a feature association linking the area served with another feature describing the provider. Role controlledService encodable only as a generic inverse association in 3.0.0 datasets as it is an information->feature link

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:name: Spatial Association
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:definition: Association for linking spatial quality to spatial objects.

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:name: Location Hours
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:definition: Working hours for a service or facility described by a geographic location.
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:remarks: This association links a geo feature to a Service Hours object. Distinction: authyHours, which links an information type (Authority) to a Service Hours object.

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:name: Service Availability
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:definition: The services available within a location.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureAssociation.S100FC:name: Subsection
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureAssociation.S100FC:definition: A division of a feature into parts of the same type as the whole.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureAssociation.S100FC:name: Infrastructure
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureAssociation.S100FC:definition: The infrastructure facilities in an area.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureAssociation.S100FC:name: Primary/Auxiliary Facility
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureAssociation.S100FC:definition: Describes the relationship between a primary feature and a feature that plays a supporting role in the use of the primary facility by a vessel.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureAssociation.S100FC:name: Demarcation
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureAssociation.S100FC:definition: Demarcation of location(s) within a feature by relation to another feature or features

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureAssociation.S100FC:name: Jurisdictional Limit
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureAssociation.S100FC:definition: The limit(s) of a jurisdiction claimed by a coastal State.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureAssociation.S100FC:name: Layout Division
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureAssociation.S100FC:definition: A division of a feature into parts of type(s) different from the type of the whole.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureAssociation.S100FC:name: Text Association
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureAssociation.S100FC:definition: A feature association for the binding between a geo feature and the cartographically positioned location for text.

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:name: Information Type
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:definition: Generalized information type which carries all the common attributes.

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:name: AbstractRxN
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:definition: An abstract superclass for information types that encode rules, recommendations, and general information in text or graphic form.

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:name: Available Port Services
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:definition: Services that are available for a given port.

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:name: Applicability
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:definition: Describes the relationship between vessel characteristics and: (i) the applicability of an associated information object or feature to the vessel; or, (ii) the use of a facility, place, or service by the vessel; or, (iii) passage of the vessel through an area.

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:name: Authority
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:definition: A person or organisation having political or administrative power and control.

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:name: Contact Details
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:definition: Information on how to reach a person or organisation by postal, internet, telephone, telex and radio systems.

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:name: Entrance
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:definition: The seaward end of a channel, harbour, dock, etc.

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:name: Nautical Information
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:definition: Nautical information about a related area or facility.

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:name: Non-Standard Working Day
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:definition: Days when many services are not available. Often days of festivity or recreation or public holidays when normal working hours are limited, especially a national or religious festival, etc.

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:name: Service Hours
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:definition: The time when a service is available and known exceptions.

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:name: Recommendations
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:definition: Recommendations for a related area or facility.

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:name: Regulations
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:definition: Regulations for a related area or facility.

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:name: Restrictions
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:definition: Restrictions for a related area or facility.

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:name: Spatial Quality
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:definition: The indication of the quality of the locational information for features in a dataset.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Feature Type
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: Generalized feature type which carries all the common attributes.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Organization Contact Area
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A feature often associated with contact information for an organization that exercises a management role or offers a service in the location.
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:remarks: It is not a requirement that every instance of the feature be associated with a management, reporting, or service organization.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Supervised Area
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A location which may be supervised by a responsible or controlling authority.
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:remarks: It is not a requirement that every feature instance be associated with an authority. Note that having AbstractService as well as SupervisedArea allows the subclasses to link to CONDET both directly and via AUTORI, which may not be desirable because it gives encoders two ways to reach almost the same result.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Harbour Physical Infrastructure
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: The physical installations and facilities that support operations in a port or harbour.
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:remarks: This generic type can serve as a super-class or aggregation type for classes defining specific feature types.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Layout
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: The spatial arrangement of areas and other types of locations that are designated for specified purposes or otherwise distinguished from other areas and locations.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Anchor Berth
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A designated area of water where a vessel, sea plane, etc., may anchor.
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:remarks: In general the anchor berth is defined by the centre point and a swinging circle radius.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Anchorage Area
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: An area in which vessels or seaplanes anchor or may anchor.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Berth
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: Place in which a ship is moored at wharf.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Berth Position
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A specific position within a berth where a vessel may be moored or anchored.
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:remarks: Within a Berth, Anchor Berth or Multiple Buoy Mooring berth, there may be many possible Berth Positions. The space required to berth the vessel may vary depending on its type and size.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Dock Area
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: An artificially enclosed area within which ships may moor and which may have gates to regulate water level.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Dry Dock
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: An artificial basin fitted with a gate or caisson, into which vessels can be floated and the water pumped out to expose the vessel's bottom. Also called graving dock.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Dumping Ground
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A sea area where dredged material or other potentially more harmful material, for example explosives, chemical waste, is deliberately deposited.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Floating Dock
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A form of dry dock consisting of a floating structure of one or more sections which can be partly submerged by controlled flooding to receive a vessel, then raised by pumping out the water so that the vessel's bottom can be exposed.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Gridiron
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A structure in the intertidal zone serving as a support for vessels at low stages of the tide to permit work on the exposed portion of the vessel's hull.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Harbour Area (Administrative)
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: The area over which a harbour authority has jurisdiction.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Harbour Area Section
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A distinguishable portion of the area over which a harbour authority has jurisdiction.
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:remarks: Denotes a specific, distinguishable or designated portion of a harbour or port area, as distinct from the entire harbour or port area.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Harbour Basin
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: An enclosed area of water surrounded by quay walls constructed to provide means for the transfer of cargos from and to ships.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Harbour Facility
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A harbour installation with a service or commercial operation of public interest.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Mooring/Warping Facility
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: The equipment or structure used to secure a vessel.
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:remarks: heavingLinesFromShore added as a boolean attribute instead of a listed value in categoryOfMooringWarpingFacility

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Outer Limit
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: The extent to which a coastal State claims or may claim a specific jurisdiction in accordance with the provisions of International Law.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Pilot Boarding Place
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A location offshore where a pilot may board a vessel in preparation to piloting it through local waters.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Seaplane Landing Area
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A designated portion of water for the landing and take-off of seaplanes.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Terminal
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A terminal covers that area on shore which provides buildings and constructions for the transfer of cargo or passengers from and to ships.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Turning Basin
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: An area of water or enlargement of a channel used for turning vessels.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Waterway Area
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: An area in which uniform general information of the waterway exists.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Data Coverage
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A geographical area that describes the coverage and extent of spatial objects.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Quality of Non-Bathymetric Data
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: An area within which a uniform assessment of the quality of the non-bathymetric data exists.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Sounding Datum
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: The horizontal plane or tidal datum to which soundings have been reduced. Also called datum for sounding reduction.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Vertical Datum of Data
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: Any level surface (for example Mean Sea Level) taken as a surface of reference to which the elevations within a data set are reduced. Also called datum level, reference level, reference plane, levelling datum, datum for heights.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Text Placement
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: The Text Placement feature is used in association with the Feature Name attribute or a light description to optimize text positioning in ECDIS.
